I’ve been to a couple other houses of family and friends with similar speeds, and similar number of devices, only thing that was different was the router, and this router seems in comparison, working far better. So long story short the router works great, and easy to use.
title: Chiga, chiga, wha, wha?

author: Physics Dan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
review_content: I bought this after returning the AC1200.  The AC1200 had great range, but had MANY other issues.  This router doesn't have any of the issues of the AC1200, gives me great speeds, and is very user friendly.  The only issue is that the range is less than the AC1200.  If you have a 2000 sq foot house and this is located on one side of the house, you won't get great signal on the other and it will occasionally drop.  If you can place this in the middle of your home (wish I could), you shouldn't have any problems.
title: Wish the range was better

author: MR B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: Easy to setup. Bought the two wifi extenders as well. Router easily found them after pushing on wps buttons. Good range, maybe a little better then the old router I had that kept dropping over the last year..update have had a month. Not as happy now. Old router always had decent coverage on back porch and downstairs bedroom. Now seems to struggle on coverage. never had that on old router. and that's with two extenders downstairs.Update. Bought this junk in july an now its October. call support no help. Old router did much better. This router drops connection everyday. I got two of the TCP extenders an no help.  Sometimes I get connected other times it connects an drops. I change the channels and hz per support. I have drop the rating too one star
title: Easy to setup but junk in the end

author: Love to Read
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: I got a dud. Right out of the box TP-Link AC1750 Smart WiFi Router (Archer A7) refused to connect to the internet. I ended up working with Tech Support and it was determined to be a faulty router. I made the purchase thinking I would save some money by not paying the cable company to rent a router but have since decided to wait for WiFi 6 routers to come down in price.  When I do ultimately buy a router I will go with a different brand.
title: Would not connect to the internet

author: Parent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: Fire the money this is pretty good buy. I hope it last. I am replacing a netgear rs5700 nighthawk. The Netgear was great till it updated firmware during a tropical storm and power blinked out after that it was a brick. Called tech support and they wanted to charge a 1time fee $85 so I said no thanks and bought this one for a few dollars more.Pros :App shows me to see which devices are burning up the most data and allowed me to custom control the time. Comcast charges $50/10gig after your allotment of 1.2tb.I can adjust the radius of wifi if needed to shrink to the house perimeter. Although I don't think anyone is parking outside my home to jump my wifi.Cost for the product and app service is value efficient.ConsSimilar to most wifi routers they need to be in the open in sight to be effective and they are not the prettiest thing.
title: Happy purchase I hope it last longer than the nighthawk.

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2019
review_content: So we have a 4 person household.  2 teens who game constantly and the missus and me who stream netflix, ect.  Our internet maxes out at 10mps, and we rarely have any problems.  In fact the boys thought I was wasting my time getting this because they wanted a bigger internet package.  But they're quite happy now and believers in better wireless routers.  Also I downloaded the Tether app on my phone and it's great.  I set up parental controls for internet hours, and can block users from anywhere should they get grounded from their games.  Tether also keeps the boys from defeating my parental controls because the controls are are on the cloud, resetting the router does nothing, haha!
title: Happy

author: Mike T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2019
review_content: (Had this router for two months and tried everything)This router is perfect when it’s not taxed with bandwidth. If we’re streaming Roku with a phone or two on and a PS4 it’s mostly problem free. Well, 2 PS4’s, 3 iPhones, Roku, 3 PC’s and 2 iPads spells trouble. Now I’m not an idiot and I don’t have everything running and streaming at the same time. That said 2 PS4, playing online  with Roku streaming and iPhone doing this and that shouldn’t be an issue with a 200 mb line. Once the archer reaches its capacity speeds come to a crawl, around 2-5 mb. This forces a restart which is good for about 30 min, then bam! Dead again. If you have a small network I’d maybe say this router might be okay. I consider mine a small network so maybe an extremely small network might be okay LOL!! In any situation I had really high expectations for this router and it really let me down. When the speed drops and everyone is pissed is really sucks to know that it won’t carry the load. Returned and got the Linksys ac1750 with MIMO. So far so good!
title: When the going gets tough, the tough quit!

author: shellcollector
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
review_content: This router worked beautifully for 4 months for internet and streaming tv with a Roku (without an ethernet cable).  Then it just stopped working.  No tv or internet.  The computer could not (and still cannot) detect a WIFI signal for the internet.Customer service/tech support was deplorable; waited 1.5 hours on hold and had to call back 3 times over two days.I ended up fixing it myself by using an ethernet cable  from my computer to the router to obtain internet.  I would think the so-called tech support would have known that and given me some direction instead of wasting my time and being rude.And as there is known problem with this router tech support should be able to fix it or replace the unit.
title: Worked well for 4 months

author: Carol and David Melvin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
review_content: Great value router, but does not manage 2.4G and 5g channels automatically as a single SSID (router name on wifi), you have to have 2 separate channels (and it can use a guest channel as well). I would give it 5 stars if it had that feature. Another issue is that in order to turn on QOS (preference for bandwidth to your smart TV for instance) you have to turn off a NAT function that is on by default and it is buried in the advanced options menu.
title: Mandatory 2 channels, but works well

author: John Li
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
review_content: First of all, I do not like the way the product is delivered. It was delivered to me without package box (see picture). It does not have plastic wrap on the product box. Not even a piece of tape sealing the box. It makes me think if it a used product. The plastic bag holding actually device seems to be opened... odd. Does anyone have their delivered like that?To be fair, setup is quite easy, it is plug and play it recognize it and I am able to connect to it with the default setting. I have yet to change any setting yet so I am not sure if interface is friendly.In term of Signal and speed, i thought i will be faster than the Verizon Fios router. I have a 940mb fios connection. Fios wifi speed is at 200mb-235mb up/down. I purchased this router thinking it will provide more speed but it actually under perform the Fios router. It was at 200-210mb when close to the router. It decrease to 100mb when i'm 20-30 feet away.
title: Don't know if it's used product.. product under perform.

author: Linda G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: Looking to upgrade my network without spending an arm and a leg I read for days before choosing this router. I had always used Belkin and Asus routers in the past so this was my first TPlink. It gives a strong wireless signal in every foot of my home including the garage and onto the patio, about 3000 sq. ft. I've had it several weeks with no issues so far. I made my old router into an access point so now I have wireless all the way out into my husband's man cave. Router location is key to using a wireless network to its fullest potential.  I have 3 PC, a laptop, tablet, 2 FireTV sticks, 2 wireless printers that so far have never lost signal. Glad I took a chance on another brand.
title: Excellent router

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2020
review_content: When I switched to TP-Link from my old Asus router, which died, I lost the ability to report my monthly internet usage.  TP-Link will report cumulative usage by individual connected IP addresses, but will not total, or download. This make the data pretty much useless.  Also, data is not date stamped, so no reporting for period (day, month) is possible, even with data totaled or downloaded, one would need to manually reset the data each period.
title: No internet usage reporting

author: Kate P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: I was warned it didn’t have a strong connection from the beginning by the company that set up the internet. It worked fine then though so I thought they were just trying to sell me their stuff. I’ve had it for not even two months and now I can’t get it to pass any internet on from the modem. I know the modem is working cause if I plug the cable straight into my TV it works fine but I can’t get any WiFi in my phone or laptop. Router acts like it’s working (light wise) but it’s just a big huge bluff because even though the network pops up on my phone it can’t load a single thing.
title: I’m typing this using cell phone data :)

author: warp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: The only reason I am giving it 2 stars and not one is because I should have known better. I bought a similar TP-Link (ASIN B00BUSDVBQ) a few years ago and had the exact same problem. Once I changed the network from 192.168.0.1 to 192.168.1.1 the UI becomes inaccessible. You may ask why I need it changed. I have about 20 devices that are configured for the 1.1 network that I would have to change. Never again will I purchase any TP_Link products.
title: Total crap

author: Katkellogs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: To anyone looking to buy: the company we went with for our new house said they provide a router for a fee every month. What they don’t tell you is that they make you pay but at the end of the year if you choose to cancel you have to give it back. We decided to buy our own so for the same price we wouldn’t have to ever give it back if we decided to switch providers thus saving us money in the long run. Works fantastic! Have had zero problems with our internet!
title: Works great.

author: avguy-ar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: So far the Archer A7 is working well but it's only been a month so time will tell.  I've got it located in the attic of our house where I get quite good coverage all around.  Our house is about 2,900 square feet with about 2,300 downstairs and 600 upstairs, which is my audio/music room (complete with full bathroom...ha).  I may add one of the mesh devices for better coverage for either upstairs or on the master bedroom end (most likely) IF it can be a 5GHz add on.  The majority of my devices in the house are wired which is always a better connection.  The interface is reasonably good to work with and I'd MUCH rather use that than the app which is limited at best.
title: Good unit for the money

author: KD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2019
review_content: This is the first time I used the app to set-up up a router. At first it didn't recognize the router. It took a couple of attempts to get in going. It also hung up on establishing the password. After about thirty minutes, it finally worked. So far so good. No drops in signal and speed actually got better as I am now using the max speed from my internet provider. I had been using an older Netgear N600 that started dropping out occasionally. Not sure about all of the smart features that were advertised with this model. Will find out over time I guess.
title: TP-Link AC1750 Smart WiFi Router - Set-up OK but runs well!

author: Samantha D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: Works beautifully! After starting work from home, we decided it was time to upgrade our router. Since installing this one, we had far fewer instances where we needed to reset everything. The interface is very user friendly, and I was even able to figure out a port forward, something I had not been able to do myself with previous equipment! Only had it less than a month so I am hoping it is as durable and consistent in the long run as it has made a great first impression on us so far!
title: Very pleased so far!

author: Kenneth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: Very clear directions, easy to understand, and polite customer service. I had to call the support center for help getting it to connect to the internet through my modem,  it they had my problem fixed in less than 10 minutes. No call wait time on day after thanksgiving. Will update this review if the router craps out, but so far the speed on it is great, and the user interface online for the router is very user friendly.
title: Great router and customer service!

author: Skunk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2019
review_content: So, I have 200+ mbps from my ISP - Spectrum.  Brand new out of box TPLINK AC1750 A7 drops speeds on wired connections.  Had to constantly reboot it to get speeds back but after 15-30 minutes it just drops again.  Speed drop is significant with only getting 5-7 mbps.  Upgraded firmware = same thing.  Returned it.  In looking at all reviews it seems all ac1750 routers may have this issue, regardless of manufacturer,  unless your lucky to get a good one.  Had to go back to my trusty N300.  At least I get 70 mbps without issues.
title: Wired Connections constantly dropped speeds

author: Marshall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: I cannot log in at all through the web browser interface at all.  The app is way too vague and over simplified, and I suspect it only works on one device only which is pretty stupid (if that was even the problem).  I don't even see if there is an option to change the password and network name, configure the firewall, configure the ip dresses(there's only static of dynamic option), or hide the network.I should have gotten another ASUS router. :(
title: Hate it.

author: MGreen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: The product was easy to install.  However, after just a couple of months the router had to be reset during the day for the computer to access the internet.  Then reset more than once a day.  I thought it was my laptop, but after having it checked by a techie (8 gig ram and i5 processor), it did not appear to be the computer.  I gave up for a while, long enough for the warranty to expire (my fault) and then began working through the internet provider.  They worked with me enough to show me it was the router kicking on and off:  even if the lower task bar showed "internet connection" the web pages would not load until I disconnected and reconnected at the task bar, apparently this is a Windows 10 issue as well according to my tech friend.  Would not recommend the brand.  The internet provider advocating personally for Nighthawk I may go that direction. Admittedly I am not a techie, but I am very frustrated after using the product.
title: Kicked internet connection off and on some days

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: I use a free Spectrum Modem and wanted to replace the Spectrum router which is $5/mo with my own router. With the Spectrum router I get 200mbps plus download speeds on multiple devices. With this I get 20-80mbps even at 5ghz. The speed is not so much the problem, but all devices are sluggish, like they have to think for 1 second before they download anything, and that really annoyed me - so I sent it back. I also purchased a TP-Link AC1200 range extender, and I was very happy with how that works with the Spectrum router. I think the device was ok and TP-Link probably makes good stuff, but maybe this router does not like the Spectrum modem for some reason.
title: Poor Performance with Spectrum Internet

author: RealEstateMama
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
review_content: Delivery was very quick, packaging is great and the signal works great. I am using in my commercial office (not a home). We have Cox as our internet provider and I wanted to avoid the monthly rental fees. We paired this with an ARRIS modem. I like that when we set up our internet, it automatically allows you to configure your wireless connection  You can change the wifi name and password, add a guest connection option, set up an account and download the app the manage the connections via mobile phone. This is the first day using it, so I'll try to update after a month or so to let you know how it is going. I am very happy with this purchase.
title: Arrived quickly and works great!

author: Kevin Wilkerson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2019
review_content: It’s the neutered version of the c7, made exclusively for Amazon. You lose a USB port by buying this model over the c7. But I got mine on a real bargain on a flash sale. Unfortunately for me, I bricked mine trying to install dd wrt. There’s only one beta version, and no uninstaller as of Memorial Day 2019. Dd wrt was very buggy and when I tried to revert it back to tp link firmware , poof. Shot down in flames. Btw, I bought a wrt32x from Linksys next, and I love that router! Blows this one away in every aspect
title: Don’t try to install dd wrt

author: Enolavisten
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: Yeah so this looks really nice, but it doesn't function that great. in the first few days of having it I had to repeatedly power cycle it so that it would work correctly. On top of that, the streaming is inconsistent. this isn't even a WiFi issue, I'm plugged directly into the router and the streaming quality drops sporadically throughout shows. Did not have this problem with my router which was five years old. I have had multiple instances of the internet light being lit up on the modem, but the router not passing along the  internet. The parental controls also aren't working correctly either. I had tried adding websites to the tether app to block. Every time I went through and listed every single thing I wanted, the list would randomly clear and I would have to add it again. I finally gave up and just left it with a few blocked sites. I wish I didn't sell my old router for this.
title: Don't judge a book by its cover

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
review_content: I recently obtained gigabit ethernet to my home, and needed a router capable of managing that load I picked the A7 up on a deal and tried it. So far, it has been excellent. Lots of management options including QOS and DHCP lease time, ARP binding, NAT rules, and built-in denial of service detection and avoidance. Plenty of protection for any home - perhaps even a small business. Two thumbs up from this retired IT guy...
title: nice gigabit router

author: brsr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
review_content: I received this quick. Set it up and it was working but..... Even after talking with the cable company it wouldn't work right even after changing channels. When talking to TP-Links support I was told that a bunch of settings were wrong and I had to pay 130.00 dollars up front for them to get on my computer a make changes. I told them no, and worked with what I had but could not get the speeds I should have on my internet. I wonder how many people actually did pay them. I got a different router and know I run at 92 to 96 megs steady with no changes to router settings.
title: Not right

author: SS OK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
review_content: Constantly disconnects, and the range is barely reaching 50ft. I purchased a whole slew of these things ranging from RE650 RE450 AC1750 AC1900 and NONE are compatible to create a onemesh. the AC1750 was the only one the works, but ONLY with a range extender, and NOT with other onemesh compatible routers/APs. Double check your version numbers because v5 of the 1750 is the only one compatible. the v2 of the RE650 is the only one compatible (and not specified in that listing, which I received a v1).Tech support was completely not helpful. Unfortunately I took too long to try and set these up and the return window is gone.NOT RECOMMENDED
title: be careful what version you receive and compatibility with other onemesh products

author: C. N. Lohr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: You can just install OpenWRT on this sucker right out of the box using the factory firmware from OpenWRT.  It's 100% compatible, and has great support for everything and waaay more powerful than the default firmware.  So many other routers you end up fighting with.  This one just accepts it and you're ready to rock!
title: Spectacular OpenWRT support

author: Tatia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
review_content: I found myself in dire straits one day when my router bit the dust.  I jumped on Amazon to see what had the best ratings and could get to me in one day.  This is the router I chose, and so far, it has been perfect.  I have no complaints.  A very simple set up, and was up and running in 5 minutes.  The only thing I dislike is the numerical password that I can’t remember... Netgear has those funny words with numbers and are simple to memorize.  All in all, a great purchase.
title: Does a great job!

author: Rob Parrish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
review_content: My internet provider's router is, meh...so when I made my home smarter with plugs and switches, it overloaded the ports and was causing all kinds of streaming havoc.  I bought this router (same brand as my smart plugs and switches) and moved all smart devices to the AC1750, leaving the major bandwidth users on my ISP's device.  My house is a wee bit over 4,000 square feet - but this router gives me good connectivity at both bandwidths pretty much anywhere on either floor, despite being locked in one corner of the house's bedroom closet.  Not my first TP-Link router...the last one died in 18 months...so I'll clock this one and see how it goes.
title: Used for a sub-net router

author: Tom Terrific
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019
review_content: Followed the very limited instructions.  Downloaded a confusing app for install.  Got to a point where it said"can`t connect to wifi unless you enable cookies or get out of incognito mode"  They are enabled and I was not in any incognito mode.  No help to be found on this.  Hooked up the old modem and sent this back.  I will try something else.  You need to put a book of instructions in the box. A web site is useless when you are having an issue connecting as you have to be connected to get there!.
title: Could not get it to work

author: Tech Horizon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: If you're looking for an upgrade to your wifi, look no further. This router is easily capable of handling many devices in your home all at once with fast speeds. I stream 4k content all the time on its wireless AC wifi and never have a hitch or loss of signal. I also use Google Stadia at 4k wirelessly and have no lag while gaming or loss of signal. Overall I am very happy with this router, you can also use TP links app to control all of its functions in your phone.As for the Alexa functionality, it's pretty bare bones, you can't really do much at all with it, so I wouldn't by this router if you're looking to ask Alexa to run a speed test or turn off your wifi, etc... the only thing I found it could do is turn on/off your public wifi, if you even use that feature.
title: Best router for the money!

author: IMC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2018
review_content: In my case I connected the router  to my modem via ethernet and it was easy and gave very good coverage with good wifi intensity. I later connecte a repeater that I had from a different brand to the tp link network and it was no problem.
title: Easy to install and good expanded coverage.

author: Jack Sprat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: Lost both wifi connections. TP-Link Chat was of absolutely no use but I received a call from a TP- Link techie who really new her stuff. One hour later we had everything up and running. Most pleased!  Now off to reconfigure iMacs, iPhones, iPads, Denon AVR, Sonos Connecter, Canon printer and probably assorted other stuff that I've forgotten. This is a fast router that has replaced my trusty twelve-year-old Apple Time Capsule/Router.
title: Working again! Strong signal, fast speed.

author: theasianpianist
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: I owned this for about a week before returning. For the first few days, everything was fine. After that, I would get periodic interruptions in my wireless network (multiple times in a day). My wired devices would be able to connect fine, but multiple wireless devices (Google Homes, Xbox, phone, laptop) would report no internet connection despite the internet access light on the router staying green. This issue persisted after multiple reboots of the router, and would seemingly fix itself at random only to reappear a few hours later.
title: Started dropping network after 1 week

author: Eric Yeh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
review_content: Despite the rave reviews (on AMZN and elsewhere) and 2500sqft rating, this router kept dropping for my small ~1500sqft apartment (and not only at remote locations).  Very disappointed and returned.1 extra star because I think the interface is decent, although the setup on phone isn't perfect (on my android it brought up some kind of integrated browser, then asked me to turn off cookies, but their integrated browser didn't have options on cookies!; had to do it from laptop).  Also, the QoS isn't refined enough (no application level priority, e.g. I want to give Zoom priority) -- or if there is, the instructions aren't clear enough how to get there.The one good thing I can report is that the bands didn't suddenly die, as I have had with two of TPLink's AC4000 routers.  There, the entire 2.4GHz band simply dies periodically.  Luckily, this A7 didn't have that extreme problem.  I rate the support weak here only referring to experiences on debugging my AC4000s -- it was not much use to try to ask for help on this weak signal.
title: Signal way too weak

author: Aaron D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019
review_content: For the price, you can't beat this Wi-Fi router. It has a great range and can be "meshed" with other models like it which will allow you to have what appears to be one Wi-Fi network but is actually multiple routers joined together that will switch your computers/tablets/smartphones to the strongest signal as you move around your home or property. I have one in my house and one in my detached garage and they are both meshed together so when I walk out to my garage it seamlessly "flips" over to the router in the garage.
title: Best Bang For The Buck

author: Vivian Landau
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: Honestly I’m tech dyslexic. I ordered this the night before and it arrived in about 15 hours after I placed my order. I have Spectrum as my WiFi provider. My problem was I could have two TVs on at the same time or the signal will break. And my master bedroom tv wouldn’t receive signal like if it was a dead area.. so I got the router today and have all three TVs on, a tablet and my phone connected with no problems. I can FINALLY watch tv in my bedroom before bed. The setup was beyond easy for me. The app is easy to navigate through. I am a happy customer. Also can we talk about the price?! $30 cheaper then Netgears router. I went the cheap route and glad of my outcome!
title: Very happy customer

author: Bryan M. Alegria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: I was gonna go for the ASUS brand but thought of giving this a chance. This definitely made a big improvement in our home network. Great range, complemented our ISP service and most of all, everyone at home can utilize fast internet (5-10 users i think can go online at the same time without getting a bottleneck in the net speed). Before, we had the linksys AC1200, when 3 users get into netflix, others get chappy or pixelated video quality, poor net speed and can’t handle many devices connected all at once. If you are having the same problem. Upgrade to this and it will change everything. Its also cheaper than ASUS, Linksys and Netgear.
title: It change the watching and gaming experience

author: Edwin R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020
review_content: Bought this wireless router at the beginning of the year and as of this week it is already starting to go bad. I’ve reached out to tech support to see if there is anything I can do, but so far I wish I had stayed with LinkSys. The router worked great for a while but now the signal is weak even though my TV and devices are within feet of it.
title: Started Ok, Then Died

author: once n a while
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
review_content: Haven’t upgraded routers in several years. Old reliable Netgear router finally gave out.This came with good reviews on Amazon and elsewhere on the internet.Extremely happy with it so far. I had no idea how slow my router was or how fast my internet actually is with a good router. This thing makes my pages load lickety split - the way it should have been all along. I had no idea.The setup is super simple and the app is very easy to use and configure.  Had it all replaced and running in about 15 minutes from box opening to pulling up a web page.
title: Super simple set up and easy to use.  Very fast too.

author: Kyle Hicks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: This router is stellar. We have had them for a while now, of which I bought two, and I replaced our standard wifi router with one, then used the other one as an access point in our basement. This works well, and does the job adequately for what I was looking to do; however, my only complaint is with OneMesh-there are other brands that allow you to take a wifi router and use them as a signal extender or repeater, not an access point. I was hoping I could do the same here, which is not the case. If this is something you're looking to take advantage of, you'll need one of TPLink's repeaters or extenders. I REALLY hope TPLink changes this, as ASUS allows two routers to mesh like that as do some other brands. But, while this DOES warrant a dropped star, TPLink advertises the units in a way that makes it really feel like they support this on multiple routers when that just isn't true, it still was a cakewalk to set the second one up as an access point, and the UI is clean, simple, and efficiently designed. All in all...while it DOES lose the star in terms of tech support for the slightly misleading claim on OneMesh...the unit itself still is a 5-star unit, comparable in performance to some of Ubiquiti's higher tier routers.
title: SOLID overall Router-but don't buy more than ONE if looking to use OneMesh

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
review_content: I'm currently on my second one of these routers because the first one failed within 3 weeks. We were watching TV one day when our wireless signal suddenly disappeared. After investigating I found that our cable modem was still connected to the internet but this TP-Link router had only its power light illuminated. Nothing would bring it back to life, including holding the recessed Reset button for 30 seconds, trying different power outlets, etc. I even went through a whole chat with TP-Link customer support (which wasn't a great experience; the person was rapidly copy-pasting troubleshooting steps into the chat and explaining that Resetting the router was not the same as turning it off and back on, after I had already explained to them that I had tried resetting it). That chat with support abruptly ended with them sending me an RMA number, indicating that they had decided the router was faulty (they never apologized or said "your router is faulty" they just pasted an RMA number and ended the chat). Thankfully I did not have to return the router to TP-Link directly, I just sent it back to Amazon. Good marks for Amazon's return policy, bad marks for TP-Link's support and product quality.
title: First unit failed after less than a month

author: Rick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: Before I bought this router I read all the reviews, I was fooled by all the reviews! First AMAZON sent me a USED covered in paint drops and smelling cigarettes, so I returned and bought another one on PRIME NOW. At first worked very nice, after a while i noticed the internet dropping everyday, all the time, i had to restart it several times per day, I contacted my Internet provider and they could not find anything wrong with my internet, I bought a new modem and requested increase on the internet speed, did not work. I started to research online and i saw several complaints about this router, I did everything possible to fix updated firmware its up to date, changed channels ,changed the location etc etc etc, frustrating. I deeply regret the money that I spent on this router, I am going to order Asus router to replace it!  I never had problem with Asus before.
title: Regret!

author: sagebrushfreak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: I have used other brands of routers over the years. I did not realize how bad the xxxxgear router was until I setup and installed this one.  No issues setting up with wireless internet ISP. Instant on. Internet account set right up. Phone app worked as expected. The software is stupid simple. I bought the matching extender to increase signal to one room in house. This router and extender is the first WPA setup Ithat only took  two button pushes. Plugged it in the wall hit both wpa buttons and bam done.I ran download and upload tests before and after. This router was double the speed. My phone kept having system crashes surfing the web. I installed this router. All gone.  I am now a brand believer.
title: Easiest Router I have ever setup

author: CMS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: I had one of those older overpriced Verizon routers and wasn’t getting solid WiFi into half of my 1300sq ft house. Being on the cusp of more competitively priced WiFi 6 routers, I didn’t want to break the bank, but it’s 2020, and bad WiFi isn’t cute anymore. This was a great buy.I get WiFi throughout the house easily. It’s iffy on my porch, but my house is brick, so this may just be a fact of life. For 70 bucks, it’s easily double the coverage I got from my Verizon router that cost twice the money, and it should do me just fine for the next couple years if need be. The set-up and app are also refreshingly clean and simple. TP Link showing value for money yet again.
title: Great inexpensive solution while we wait for WiFi 6 to become reasonable

author: twalker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I used this for about 2 months and I kept hearing the squalling from my family: "DAD, I can't get on the internet", wife: "why does the internet keep dropping out?" I even had problems connecting my laptop to it wirelessly. I had to separate the 5ghz and 2.4ghz channels to get my laptop to connect. my laptop is in the same room as the router and it still had problems connecting to 5ghz channel. I am an IT guy by profession. I fix network and computer problems for a living and I could not make this thing work reliably so that is why I am giving it a 1 star. I know that this router has good ratings but I can not give it a good rating.
title: Nope

author: bingo51
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: I have no problem in installing this product using the cable connecting it to my router. However, the installation for the wireless option is not straight forward. The instruction in the box is not useful. I have to call tech support a few times and they were very helpful. One tech sent me a link for the manual that has the details for the installation for the wire option. However, it still took me three tries. I use it as the range extender and it works but the range is not great but it allows me to connect my TV in the master bedroom on my house second floor to my router located on my office on the first floor using the 5G wifi. The wifi signal to my TV thru my Roku is not very fast (~ 40 Mbs although my iPhone receives more than 100 Mbs ) but is very decent so we still could watch TV thru Roku and Comcast . I have it for a few months now and don't have any problem. I give this product 4 stars for its limited range but I  believe that it's still a good price for this performance. The Orbi router could be better but at three times of the price.
title: TP-Link AC1750 Smart WiFi Router as Range Extender

author: Doe Z
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: I have never ever installed a router before but mine was slowly fading away so after reading the reviews I got this one. I had the old one unplugged and this one plugged in the same spots in 10 seconds, then a careful 5 minutes of hooking it up via the free app and omg it's like a whole new world in here. I got used to waiting on the spinning wheel of death on my computer and now everything is so fast it's almost silly. If you are looking for a router and this one is compatible with whatever you've got, just get it. It works great and requires only the ability to read and type in numbers and plug in plugs to set it up for immediate use. I'd give it 100 stars if I could.
title: Yes it is that easy.

author: peaceful shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: My wifi speed at home slowed to a crawl on my basic cable internet plan.  I was afraid I'd have to upgrade to a higher tier service.  I don't have much wiggle room in my monthly budget and do all I can to keep my monthly costs at a minimum. Before upgrading my service, I decided instead to see if a new router would have an impact, which over time, was a lot cheaper than increasing my monthly bill.  So glad I did...what a difference!  I'm back in the fast lane on the information superhighway on the same internet plan.  Other pluses: this router resets and connects so much faster than my former router, also a TP-Link & it has a stronger signal and longer/further range.  I'm very satisfied with this product.  It's been 3 months now and have had no issues.
title: Great router!

author: macd2point0
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: I replaced my old Asus RT-ACRH13 AC1300 router when it stopped working, with this model AC1750. Hoping for an upgrade in performance, I got anything but. 4k video would stop frequently because of buffer timeout. Multiple streams will bring this router to its knees.I also wasn't a fan of the administration interface/reliance on the Tether app. Some people are just more comfortable going to a router's zip address.
title: Struggles with 4k video

author: Unni B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: Setup was easy and intuative, but it ends there.  Performed a firmware update basically during the process of the initial setup of the device.  Noticed within the hour that the internet became sluggish, ping times to my web server went from 10ms to several seconds.  I have 200/5 Mbit service and at times my download was in the single digits according to speedtest.net. When the device was rebooted it went back to normal, but then again a few minutes later it was horrible.  Attempted factory reset, that didn't help, reverted back to an older 2019 firmware, that didn't help either.  Played with QOS, Nat Boost, MTM, all the ALG options, but this device just kept going from screaming fast to barely working.  Spent more time on this in the past day trying to make it work than I have in the last 7 or 8 years with my old ASUS RT-N56U (which I am now using again).  Assuming I got a lemon so rather than work with tech support I am just going to return this one.  Likely not going to pursue any further TP-Link products.  Buyer beware!
title: Works great for a few minutes then Internet speeds fall off a cliff

author: Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: My previous WiFi (2Ghz) router was insufficient to produce a full strength signal at all areas of my house (3600ft2).  Even if I had devices in close proximity with full signal strength, my old router could not pass the necessary bandwidth to prevent buffering and disruptions from occurring during streaming.  I purchased the TP-Link AC1750 and have been fully satisfied.  I have it located centered in my home and I have full signal strength through out the house.  More importantly I have streaming on multiple devices and no buffering.  4K streaming, no problem.  I actually had my internet provider come to my house to check my internet connection.  The problem was the modem.  This new modem has no problem supporting all the devices in my home (smart TV, Laptops, Smart Phones, etc.), a household of 5 (2 parents and 3 teenagers).
title: WiFi Upgrade

author: Bobster
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
review_content: I read several reviews where people had to call tech support just to get this router to connect.. I thought these were probably folks who had never installed a router before.  Unfortunately I followed several online reviews which highly recommended this model only to have a frustrating experience like others.  I've installed many a router and work in IT so I don't believe it's user error but this thing would not connect to the internet no matter what I did.  And yet the indicator lights on the front all showed green as in all connections good. Save yourself the trouble and stay away no matter how attractive the price or how many experts recommend it.
title: BEWARE

author: Gilbert and Karen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
review_content: 5 stars: 1g ports was giving me 200+ mobs DL speeds which is what I was subscribed to.1 star: 2.4ghz was only giving me 38mpbs DL speeds and gets worse as I move around the house.  Product labeling said up to 300mbps2 stars:  5 ghz gave me 200+ mbps when literally my device was next to the router.  Lost 100mbps just by moving 10 ft away, no wall obstructions.  Gets worse as you move further away.My house is 2200, router is positioned at the center of the house.
title: Poor Wireless signal

author: StarCrashr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
review_content: I've had bad luck buying routers lately, and was prepared to be disappointed considering the price. I was originally planning to test the hardware to verify its capabilities, then void the warranty by replacing the firmware if the hardware meets my needs. The hardware exceeds my expectations, and the firmware has everything I wanted and more, negating the need for customization. It even has a built in VPN server, which I was expecting to need to buy a raspberry pi for. I was also expecting to need to buy a second router to get full coverage of my home, but this one has better range than all of my previous routers combined, allowing me to simplify my network by replacing several wireless access points with inline couplers. I'd say this is suitable for small businesses on a budget if you'd rather not pay enterprise prices, despite apparently being marketed for personal home use.
title: Surprisingly good for its price.

author: Tom Butler
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: I had struggled to install another router and finally gave up on it.  Purchased this one and had it up and running in less than 30 minutes.  I am just using the basic router and am using both the 2.5GHZ and 5GHZ channels through out an area of approximately 1,100 sq ft with good reliable reception and use on both channels.  The router is located at the extreme end of the area.  We use the device for streaming throughout the area and it easily supports 2 simultaneous streaming activities on a regular basis as well as the normal functions of  smartphones.  If we run into any issues with the device, I will update the review.
title: Excellent - Easy setup -Great Performance

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
review_content: I bought this router to replace a 5 year old Belkin that would occasionally hick-up and drop signal. I'm running 5 wireless devices - Alexa, a Kindle, laptop, Smartphone and a Smart tv set. The laptop connected faster but the signal degraded 20' away to my tv. I was unable to stream a Netflix movie w/out the signal dropping or the picture getting fuzzy. I tried both channels on the router, gave up after one day and replaced my old Belkin. Set up was extremely easy. I didn't even try my Alexa Tap downstairs for signal distance.
title: Fair signal at 20 feet

author: Odyn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: If we had 100-300+Mbps bandwidth rate, then this would have been a good economical router.  We have only 6Mbps from a radio antenna shared amongst 5 users and 15 devices, plus most of us are gamers.  The newest firmware took away an important bandwidth limiting feature in the QoS.  So our Interpolation Delay was from 50 to 200 ms and latency from 90ms into the several hundreds for the gamers.  I had to switch back to our 20 year old Linksys router which I could at least limit the WiFi users and allocate 80% of the bandwidth for the gamers with Interpolation Delay around 50ms and latency about 70ms, more tolerable for living in the boondocks.
title: Not good for very low bandwidth ISPs

author: Steve Sellers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2019
review_content: This router is great for a 3 story townhouse. The signal is consistently strong and the range (even for 5Ghz) hits every corner of the house. If you've done your research, this router will almost always show up on a recommended list - especially for the under $100 category. If you don't need all the bells and whistles of the high end models (that 95% of people probably will never use) and just want a great router for a great price than this is the one to get.The only quirks I have are the app and the router configuration page. TP-Link's Tether app can be a little wonky. Sometimes trying to navigate the app (even at home connected to the router) can be very slow and may sometimes time-out/error-out. Also I wish the default router config page stayed on 192.168.0.1 instead of automatically navigating to http://tplinkwifi.net. It would be nice to have the option of which page you'd like to have as the default as I've heard the latter page can be insecure / susceptible to hackers.
title: Probably the best sub $100 router you can buy right now (as of 2019)

author: Losfirstduty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
review_content: We have been using this router for several months.  Got Google Fiber and the fiber box had very poor performing wi-fi for our needs.  We have a 2,290 sq ft house and we needed an add on to meet the needs of the electronics we use.This router does the job for us, managing several items in conjunction with wi-fi extenders.  Like that we can create a visitor's account and place restrictions as needed.  I would recommend restarting the router to fresh updates and clear cache.Easy to set up and wall mount.  The app is great to manage the account and services - does not give you full account services just what you need to be mobile.
title: Top Performing Router

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
review_content: If internet was always this easy, I wouldn't have been so anxious about buying a new router.Step 1) Follow the quick installation guide (please follow it, because I didn't at first and nothing worked).Step 2) Log into router, 192.168.0.1 for me. Follow steps.Step 3) QUADRUPLED my internet speeds because the old router I had was a DIR-632 and clearly broken.I will update this if I run into any trouble, but the pros right now are:1) Pretty to look at2) 3 antennas and mesh Wi-Fi3) Amazing user interface (YOU CAN TURN OFF THE LEDS IF YOU WANT - THIS IS HUGE)4) Work well immediately with the existing modem I owned.5) I caught the delivery guy before he left a note saying he missed me for delivery.I have been heavily irritated with my internet lately, so go ahead and drop the cash and get this thing - it's amazing :)
title: If internet was always this easy, I wouldn't have been so anxious about buying a new router...

author: Meggie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: While knowing this was a bargain router, our old was, too. This works okay, but is just a little slower in tests than the six-year-old router is. I say is, because I'm considering switching back to the old one and returning this.Update: Taking off two stars. This thing is incredibly slow when everyone is online.Update 2: Trying to get a few months' use out of this thing. Using cell service for phones and tablets instead of wifi. Now it has to be restarted every day or two when it loses connection.As for the suggestion that I jump through more hours of hoops to make this device work like it should, I value my time more than that. And I have never needed to do that with other brands' wifi routers.
title: Surprisingly, no improvement on our old bargain router

author: John John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: It worked okay for 10 months with good 2.4ghz service but the 5ghz was a bit disappointing. Then like others have reported in their reviews, suddenly this Nov. the 5ghz and 2.4 ghz started dropping and refusing connections requiring me to reboot the unit daily and in some cases every few hours. Even after defaulting it to factory, reloading latest firmware, etc. the problems would always reappear after a few hours.Contacted Linksys support Nov. 27th, after some brief trouble shooting with the tech, they determined my unit needed to be RMA'd...fine. I gave them a credit card number for an advanced replacement the said would be arriving in 7 business days. On Dec. 7th I notified my replacement router had just shipped....Yes, that's right.. almost two business weeks just for an "advanced" replacement to ship! I called Linksys and was told they had trouble finding an available replacement to ship. That sounded ominous but I am in it now. I was assure I would be receiving the replacement sometime within the next week (mean while there is a hold on my credit card for the cost of the replacement waiting for this replacement to arrive so I can return the malfunctioning one).We will see how the replacement performs when it arrives. But for now, I would recommend checking the other available routers before purchasing the WRT3200ACM (or if you do...keep the your old router as a spare until Linksys figures out how to properly handle problematic products).***Update***Received my replacement unit from Linksys in a couple of days....the same WRT3200ACM model. Got it online, updated the firmware...bam same problem.Now on the Linksys support site only a firmware version from months ago is available with a note that people experiencing problems should roll back the firmware to the old version (which btw doesnt address the KRACK exploit vulnerabilities). I did the roll back as instructed. Still having issues with devices staying connected.Guess I will have to stand in line with the other WRT3200ACM owners waiting for the Linksys team to let the customers be their beta testers. Wondering if Linksys will make this right.***Update***
title: based on the good reviews and belief that Linksys produced a good product.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: Setup was fairly straightforward. Signal was not half as fast as advertised. But my main gripe would be that the internet port stopped working after 2 months, rendering the router useless. Then since it was outside of the return window through Amazon, I had to go through TP-Link's RMA process to get a replacement. I chose the advanced return policy so I wouldn't have to go ahead and ship the broken router back to them before I received the replacement one. But the 3-5 business day process for shipping cost me $15 to send the old unit back. I filled out the information for the return, and when I looked at my bank balance after it posted, I was charged $84.98. They apparently charge you the full amount of the replacement device plus shipping until you send them the broken device back, then they are supposed to reimburse you the cost of the device. So mad that it didn't just break before May 31 so I could return it to Amazon and not have to incur these fees or hassle.  Then I would just be able to buy something else.
title: Broken after 2 months and replacement process is terrible

author: Jamr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: Had this router for a year or two. The router works well good speeds for gaming but I must warn you that if you are thinking of using the parental controls, they did not work for me and I am pretty savvy with this stuff.Settings as basic as turn off internet access between this time and that do not work in fact they do work when the are not suppose to and do not work when they are suppose to which is much worse than not working at all.So again, good general router, not a lot of bells and whistles except for the guest WIFI, but if TP-Link can not even get the parental controls to work, I doubt any of the other features fork correctly. At least, I surly would not trust them to work correctly.
title: Good Router Parental Controls Useless!

author: Maltboy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
review_content: I bought this because of all the positive reviews.  I upgraded the firmware immediately after I got it running.  I noticed right away that the 5g would lose connection even though I am 20 feet from the router and can literally see it from where I'm sitting.  Not good.  Then the 2g started acting up.  Now it won't download more than about 50 kbs.  I have read similar reviews about poor signal quality.  I'm going to return this router and try another brand.  This is a cheap router, and you get what you pay for.
title: Worked only so-so for a couple of weeks, then it got worse.

author: Lord lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
review_content: update: my old modem router was zoon and the range was a lot better however it is fine and cover my 2 floor house easy up to 80 ft away from the house, the speed for this one is still very nice and the best I like about it how easy to set up, with many options to change settings including how easy way to change your IP.the software update is so easy and done online, make a cloud account before you start using their app. I had to connect it to the computer however it was very easy fast and you can activate both band or one and the G5 is crazy fast, the thing I like about it that it gives you new IP which means you can always change it, and a firewall, adding new WIFI printer was so easy by using the WPS, it is a good buy for sure.
title: FANTASTIC

author: Parent of Two
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: The product works great overall. My range is definitely expanded with the use of this device. I am able to stream multiplayer games with limited issues. The tether app is great for overseeing who’s on the device and what is using the most data. The device experienced an update malfunction which made it unusable. I was initially told it was my fault by the company and was very frustrated with this. A few days later a supervisor contacted me after reviewing my case and resolved the issue. I did not ask for another opinion, they simply reviewed on their own and made a new decision. I am happy with this and will be getting a new device. Loyal customer now.
title: Powerful device with great customer service

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
review_content: I'm the type to not review things. Even when companies offer free things for positive reviews. So know that it is very difficult for me to do this..... Review of the TP-link AC1750 "smart" Wifi router.If you want a router that doubles the ping you get in video games, constantly disconnects (requiring an on-off restart) if you try and watch *gasp* 2-3 youtube videos, and if you want to resolve it they tell you to contact your isp... which doesn't resolve it. Then well have i got the product for you. Average 2 drops per day, a complete non-starter.I would rather rent (VOMIT) a router from Charter than continue to use this. Don't believe the bot reviews on this, it's a 1-2 star product, not 5. My 9 year old netgear router that cost $30 at walmart was more reliable and managed the same speed as this TP-link product.Oh, but their user interface is average. I guess its got that going for it.
title: Don't buy this

author: Brad Baranski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I used this to replace my router that was well over a decade old, and I wish I would have stuck with the old one. The range of signal is hilariously bad. Rarely does this thing stay connected for any long length of time. It also seems like it can't handle the basic speed I have from my ISP. Buy Netgear instead folks. Amazon's choice my ass.
title: Not great.

author: Banjo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: This works like it should so far.  We have no signal issues in our moderately large home.  Setup was easy (you can even do it on your phone with an app).  The connection speeds are really fast.  Our previous modem wasn't that old, but started having some issues - perhaps fried in an electrical storm.  This one gets far better speeds even though both should have been able to handle the speeds our internet service provider's package provides.
title: Easy to set up, strong signal, and fast.

author: T. Putnam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: My existing router/modem from Verizon (gateway) only produced speeds of about 20 mbps for wifi. very abysmal when my ethernet connection gets speeds of 500-600 mbps. This unit increased the wifi to about 40-50 mbps. good range - i have a 2 story 2000 s.f. house, and it reaches to the office in the opposite corner of the house. Set up was fairly easy, but the instructions didn't mention that you have to connect with the app and then choose a different pw to finish connecting. it shows up when you try to connect to the wifi and open a browser. Overall, it's a solid improvement. Because of my job requiring downloads of large files, I'm gonna check out some higher end models too, but this one is good for run of the mill household access.
title: Does improve wifi speeds

author: Ann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: I'm technically savvy enough to know I shouldn't have to call tech support just to have it work "out of the box". i did set priority for QOS and it didn't improve problem #1 below.1.  Wi-Fi calling from iPhone 5 and 6 often failed with the person  we are talking to (from our home) can't hear us, or us them.2.  Poor connection through sheet rock walls to Aria wireless scale.  connected roughly 50% of the time.
title: Had 2 problems and returned.  Amazon was an EZ return.

author: inveterate reader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: Pros: I can't think of any at this point.Cons: (1) VERY little documentation with the unit other than a card with the router's admin password.  (2) Poor build quality, very light plastics. (3) Slowed my internet connection considerably over the old Asus I had intended to replace. I switched the old router in and recovered speed immediately. Repeating the install of the TP-Link resulted in the same slowing again. Finally ordered an Asus replacement and am quite satisfied. I would not recommend this router - period.
title: Poor build, slows connection speeds. NOT a product I could recommend.

author: JaBe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: I generally don't write reviews as I expect quality products and don't normally feel like telling the world whether it was good/bad/otherwise.  But this device is rated 4.5 stars and I feel like that has to be from novice folks who plug it in and it connects and they think it's good.  I had mine running for a week with multiple issues.  1) the user interface in the browser is poor.  Just basic things like drop-downs and tiny little scroll bars, no up/down arrow function, etc make it completely substandard to what you would expect for a 2020 product.  2) i had several issues where my laptop would stop getting any internet at all.  I would reboot router and it would fix it.  3) and to top it off, it was SLOOWWWWWWW.  All week I've noticed some lagginess and slowness.  It got so bad this afternoon while trying to just browse the internet that it became unusable.  Speedtest gave me 10mb down and 3mb upload.  I put the old router back in and everything cleared up immediately.  Speedtest 80mb down/10mb up with my VPN connected.  That was the last straw.  It got put back in the box and returning.  Maybe mine was just defective but reading the other 1-star reviews, most of us experienced the same thing.  Something internally here just isn't capable of handling modern technology.
title: Slow

author: Charles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: I would've given a higher rating basis the equipment alone, but the "tech support" is sketchy. Installed fine, but as you know when you purchase and install any new hardware you should ALWAYS make sure the firmware/software is up to date. That is where the sketchy part comes in - turns out now you can't access the webpage you need for update, keeps sending you to a landing page that asks if you're having "trouble configuring your router?" It gives a number to call for "tech support" the tech will ask you to let them diagnose your machine remotely which is safe enough in most cases, BUT THEN their diagnoses turns up unknown hackers and you're referred to a 3rd party company to "clean up" the problem for $130!!  I have the #1 rated firewall installed and the tech went out of his way to tell me he never heard of it before...  I hung up. I have over 20 years of experience in this field - but I can see someone with less experience being taken advantage of by this very smooth talking "tech support" guy. Again the product itself is fine as well as the extender (extender has same firmware update scam) JUST GOOGLE THE FIRMWARE UPDATE AND FOLLOW DIRECTIONS TO DO IT MANUALLY.
title: MUST BE TECH SAAVY

author: K. Danford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: It wasn’t to bad to set up when I got it. I liked the site, however my phone always said weak security when I connected to the WiFi. It did take a while thought to get set up.  However after having it hooked up a little over a month it stopped working. I woke up to no internet connection so I turned off my modem and router to recycle. The modem came back on but the router lights came on like it was loading and before it finished loading the lights would shut off I’d have to try turning it back on. I did this three times! It did the same thing. Now I have no internet until I receive the new router that I just had to purchase.  I wouldn’t bother with this one and I will not be purchasing this brand again.  I will stick to the previous brand I had that worked for many years.
title: Quite working after a little over a month!

author: Donald P. Hurta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018
review_content: Specifically bought to use in wireless Time Machine backups on a Mac.  First off, Time Machine will only recognize disks formatted in a Mac format, but the TP router will only recognize an attached HD in PC format.  Secondly, their tech support leaves a lot to be desired: Called asking for help in getting my attached HD to be recognized and the tech support person just emailed me a link instead of talking me thru the procedure. Returned unit and bought a much pricer Netgear Nighthawk router from Staples the next day.  Called their tech support and he talked me through the procedure step by step... A huge improvement from my experience with TP.
title: NOT compatible for wireless Mac Backup! Sub par Tech Support

author: AmazonCustomer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: In preparation for having our family schooling & working from home again this fall, I knew we had to improve our internet. I bumped up our speed to 200 mbps with the cable company but was still only getting speeds in the range of 10-50 mbps. Just as an after thought, I decided to replace our router.Fairly simple setup and my first internet speed test showed 200+ mbps!! I was ecstatic! Since then, speeds haven't dropped below 110 mbps. The router really made the difference! We had already replaced our modem in April so this was clearly holding back our speeds. Two thumbs up on this router.
title: Finally getting the internet speed I was paying for!

author: SilverState55
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
review_content: This unit replaced an older Linksys router that was starting to show its age.  This unit was easy to set up, both with Bluetooth as well as via IP/browser.  Very easy to configure, and its performance exceeded my expectations!  Dual band modes work flawlessly, even multiple devices streaming all at once (Netflix, DirecTV, Amazon Prime all at same time).  No connections have dropped yet, no reboots have been necessary, and when it was first turned on all of our peripheral devices were super-easy to connect, including wireless printing.I highly recommend this unit, it does all that we want it to do, and then some!
title: Great performance for not much money, hidden gem!

author: Dog Lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
review_content: I have 60 MB Internet service and a modem/router supplied by my phone company.  In spite of assertions by my phone company tech that their router would reach every corner of my home, it does not.  I installed a WiFi extender, and it helped, but I would still get brief dropouts on my 4K HD TV.  After seeing this unit with its three antennas and good reviews, I decided to give it a try.I received it today, hardwired it to my phone company modem with Ethernet cable, installed it in about 15 minutes, and I can say nothing but wow.  I get 5 bars in most of my house, 3 bars in the farthest corners, and 2 bars on the far end of my very large garage.  100% WiFi coverage.
title: Could not be happier

author: Omar Benavidez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: When loading from product site caused home computer to crash and now computer is being worked on to restore system.  Not happy at all with product.  Upon returning package to drop off location surprisingly heard that it was 4th time this item had caused blue screen damage to home computers. Think Amazon should remove item from selling on site.  Until manufacturers can explain caused damage.
title: Not happy at all

author: Jacob Woods
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: Really wanted to like this router. Price point is good for the features. Unfortunately it wouldn't keep consistent speeds over the wired "gigabit" ethernet ports. On my 400mbps Spectrum service I would get anywhere from 100-250mbps over ethernet. Rebooting the router would temporarily increase speeds to normal levels, but in less than an hour I'd be back to the lower speeds. On latest firmware, I played with QoS and several other settings but could not get it to consistently keep desired speed. Wifi was actually great - I would easily get 400+ mbps and range was solid too, which makes the ethernet issues even more strange. Bought a Linksys MR8300 AC2200, which of course is quite a bit more money, but is well worth it since I'm now getting 480+mbps on all devices (wired and wireless) with very little setup or special configuration needed. Will be returning the TP-LINK.
title: Disappointed - Poor Speeds Over Ethernet Ports

author: Elvin Pena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: This was a huge upgrade for me. It replaced an old tp-link type "N" router that served me well for a couple years. Too many devices where chocking my good old N router. The price vs feature was good on this router and tackled all my needs. It reaches the entire house which is concrete, rebar and cinder blocks. The signal does reach the basement but with significant signal loss as opposed to upstairs, but it reaches my basement through concrete and rebar floor and walls, a thing the other router couldn't.The performance and range of all my wifi devices improved significantly with this router.
title: Upgrade my old  N router with this one and it worked out very well!

author: Blake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: After using this for about 6 months, I decided to upgrade since I had over a dozen connected devices and liked to take meetings on my back garden where the signal was a bit weak.I ordered the TP-Link AX3000 as it has FOUR antennas and it supposedly built for lots of connected devices, faster speeds, longer range, etc. It's 3x the price of this A7.With the 'better/upgraded' router my devices took longer to respond, the TV loaded way slower, and I got NO signal in my back garden.... Needless to say I happily returned the AX3000, got my $150 back and am now thrilled with the Archer A7!
title: I didn't realized how good it was until I tried to upgrade to a router 3x the price.

author: Michelle O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
review_content: This product is no longer supported with manufacturer updates so the fact it's still on the market is incredibly deceiving. The primary issue is that after 2 days of working great, this router loses internet connection every 5 minutes. If you only want to use wifi for 5 minutes at a time, please do get this. If you actually want wifi, find something else.
title: Don't buy this absolute did.

author: P. Von Bargen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2018
review_content: I upgraded my old D-Link router and this new router and its controlling software and app are killer! So very pleased with my purchase!
title: Perfect home router with easy to use software and app!

author: Jimmyt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: I liked that it was pretty much a plug and play.  There is a cellphone app you can install.  I am disappointed that plugging my external hard drive doesn't exactly work as a folder.  Instead files are only displayed in certain formats (e.g., video files).  Also, I am not sure if verizon is reducing my speed because of a non-verizon modem, but there has been a slowdown.  It could also be because I am now using more wifi devices then before (reason why I upgraded in the first place).
title: Easy to set up

author: Erik G Preiss
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2020
review_content: I "upgraded" to this router to take advantage of the higher internet speeds my ISP started to provide.  Worked well for several months before it started to drop the WAN connection for some devices connected via wifi.  Some devices would continue to work fine while others lost connection to the cable modem.  Upgraded firmware and tried to troubleshoot different settings with no luck.  Just had it drop a wired connection while the wifi connected devices continued to work fine, will be looking for a new router this evening.
title: unstable

author: Sage Brush
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
review_content: This TP-Link AC1750 was super easy to hook up to the new Netgear modem I also purchased. I couldn't get the modem to work with my computers even though it was successfully connected to the internet and I had one computer hard wired with a LAN cable. So I plugged in this wifi router and unplugged the LAN. Installation was a breeze and presto - internet connection on all three computers. Seems to be fast as I am getting a little over the mps that my plan allows. No signal drops so all OK. I will update review if any problems arise but right off the bat it works well and was easy-peasy to set up.
title: WOW that was easy

author: craig
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: I like that this item has a Guest WiFi option. I enjoy parental controls and the signal strength. Easy to setup for sure. Device is protected in plastic, even the 3 antennas. GOOGLE HOME/NEST NEED TO BE FACTORY RESET IN ORDER TO WORK WITH THIS DEVICE. At first I didn't know this and figured it was only compatible with Alexa. But once I figured it out, things are better than ever. Definitely running more of my modem speed through the WiFi!!!! Significant difference. Instruction manual is a fold out not a book. Not a fan of that, myself. Easy to use setup wifi names and passwords on a convenient card. The app that you use for this is very user friendly. Highly recommended!
title: Awesome WiFi router! Lots of options!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
review_content: Worked well with our Verizon Fios. We are relieved we didn’t need to rent or buy a router from Verizon. Very pleased with the router
title: Verizon compatible

author: Vy Ly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: I bought this router just 5months and it keep disconnecting 6 times. Every time it disconnected I kept turn on and off and resetting...Last time I couldn’t connect to the internet even I did same thing like before but no internet and I did call customer service. Amazon cannot do anything help and I have to wait for an hour to get help from other person and they just cannot help me to get the internet backCannot exchange or returnReally disappointed with amazon service
title: No internet

author: Orlando Villalon Jr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
review_content: Usually not into “best seller” or amazon recommended/favorite. I did my research on this item and for the price it was decent to use, could use newer security protocols but it is old.Tether app is easy to use, love the parental control. I cut off my wife’s internet at night time LOL!Signal is great, I had spectrum Ultra 400mb/s, had it on 2nd floor middle of the house. It can reach down to basement, really great coverage. Get about 150-200mb/s in other rooms.Changed to basic internet of 200mb/s, have the WiFi router in the living room instead which is on one end of the house. No signal at the far end of the house or barely but on 2.4ghz. Got a 2nd one on prime day, will be placing it on the original location on the 2nd floor.
title: Great router

author: M&A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
review_content: Bought this WiFi router February 4, 2020. Today is April 11, 2020 and the box is fried. Would not recommend at all. It was continually slow, did not give me all of my bandwidth and had horrible range. The features would have been amazing had they worked properly. My VPN was working fine until using this router. Yes, this router was approved for my VPN services. It just did not want to work. The final straw was today when I came home and I had no internet. Did quite a bit of troubleshooting on my own, with my provider and also had my IT neighbor down to have a look at it. He narrowed it completely down to the router. Had to reinstall my router from the company I purchase my internet from. I also cannot get a refund now since it’s been 2 months.  Wry disappointing and a waste of my money.
title: Does not work well, fried in 2 months.

author: Estefanie💕💕
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: Ever since I started working from home my internet would always have low signal. I decided to purchase this product to see if I would have stronger WiFi network. It seems as though I do. I no longer have an issue with the WiFi not being connected or not having signal. I have my PS4, my work laptop, and my phone connected to it and it seems to be working great. When I FaceTime people it would lose connection easily, when I played PS4 it would always lag, those following complications have been resolved. The only downfall is internet connection goes and comes. But, not a lot. And it connects itself again without me having to do anything:
title: Great

author: Evan Kostishak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2019
review_content: i would give this a 5 star, but our first unit failed no explanable reason. TP-link replaced it for free*, but i had to send the original back to them (*shipping cost ~15 bucks).The range on this unit is excellent and seems to handle lots of clients with no problem.
