We have started making our home "smart" with a google home, philips hue lights, lots of wifi outlets, etc., so with so many devices trying to maintain an internet connection, our old router couldnt handle it.The parental controls are also great as i can block clients individually from getting access or set them up to have access only for certain times. This is great for forcing our kids to stop using their devices when they should be sleeping
title: good range, excellent parental controls

author: Palomio
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: First I bought TP-Link Archer CR500 16x4 and returned it because was no Bueno and never worked, then I bought this TP-Link AC1750 Smart and it worked for 3 months and then I started to not show wireless antennas and it started to stop working. The two times before returning it, I called Amazon and they didn't help me and I called Tp-link and I don't care about anything either. This company is bad, I don't recommend it at all. In 6 months I bought 2 and nobody is responsible for the product, here I can see how good this company is.
title: Super bad router, i have a 150mb connection

author: Stan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
review_content: My first router last only 1 year because of a lightning strike to my home witch took out a lot of electronics.This is my second router and this one didn't make 12 months. For some reason the problem started about 2 months before total signal failure. Started to loose the internet connection  once a week than more often  until no internet. Because I have a IP phone and computers that rely on the router for the internet I just went out and bought another router.I ended up purchasing the same router  for 2 reasons, price and availability.I only gave the produce 2 stars because it failed in a very short time.
title: Router

author: Moogs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: This is a great router! I had an aged router that started slowing down and couldn’t support all my devices. Bought this thinking it was another brand, but love the “mistake” I made. Great price and great connectivity! I have my PS4 hooked up by LAN. I have two Smart TV’s, two iPads, two cellphones, and 5 security cams that run off this router. The dual band is a great benefit. The further devices are connected to the 2.4 and the closer ones are connected to the 5.
title: Highly recommend!

author: Frito
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
review_content: The A7 wifi router works well I have no problems with how well it works. The problem I had was when my system went down. When the internet rebooted I received a message to Log In to the A7 router. It asked for a password, which I did not remember. ( That is a big hint, write it down somewhere). I clicked on Forgot you Password. It then tells you to reset your wifi router. Nowhere does it tell you in the instructions how to reset this router. There is no reset button visible on the back of the router. There is no label.  I connected with the chat line, which was helpful and the support  person guided me to a little pin hole on the back of the router. You stick a paper clip or small pin into the pin hole and hold for 10 seconds. Then everything shuts down. You loose your internet connection, you lose the chat line support which feels like the world is collapsing. Soon a message will appear, thankfully, that guides you, step by step, through creating a new password and log in. And everything reboots. PS. write down your password.  There needs to be better instructions and details on where the reset button is located and how the reboot works. Once it is back up a running it works well.
title: Works well, instructions are bit hard to follow.

author: dboatrig
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: Working from home during covid-19 social distancing. A coworker is getting ~120mbps at home through the company VPN. The best I could get was ~60mbps. Then our router died recently we replaced it with a Netgear router from Costco for $199. I was hoping for an improvement in internet speed, but still only got 60mbps at best. I asked coworker (who has same internet provider as I) about his hardware and he has this AC1750, so I got it and suddenly my VPN speed has gone from 60mbps to 150mbps. Non-VPN speeds jumped even more drastically. I'm not really sure why this one is so much better, but it certainly is in our case.
title: 2-3x faster internet in my case

author: A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: Customers beware.  There are lots of porch pirates out there.  Thankfully my wife was hime for this delivery.  Amazon didn't even rebox the item.  Slapped a label on it and left it on the porch for all to see a nice piece of tech.  Kinda disappointed.3 stars until i set up the product.  It's probably great.  I'll update this laterUpdateInstallation was very simple and the app is easy to navigate.  Although i haven't tested every room yet, connection speed where tested so far is better than the router this replaced.  So far excellent purchase for the price i paid.Still only 4 stars because the way it was shipped.
title: Watch your delivery

author: Jeff Dames
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
review_content: Don’t use the app to install this router.I got to the final step and it said the “signal is unstable, try getting closer to the device”. My iPhone was 2 feet away.Better to use the simple alternative described in the install guide - using a browser. That method took 2 minutes and spotted a firmware upgrade.
title: Don’t use the app to install this!

author: Kelly Franklin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: So I figured that a newer router would give me some or ease that my older one--at least 6 years and probably much older since someone gave it to me when they bought a new one--but I was wrong. The power seems no different. And with the new one I have to very often "tell" my devices that it's there...I often have messages saying "no device found" but it's quite simple to see the list of options, click it, and continue on. With the older router, I occasionally had to re-choose it after power outages etc, but not nearly as much as this one. I guess buying a more expensive one MIGHT have been different.
title: OK, nothing greats

author: Nael Hassan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: Loved how easy the installation was. At first I was annoyed about downloading the app to set it up but when I saw how easy it was on the app, I loved it. It allowed me to change the name of the Wifi network and password with super ease. I live in the city so my house isnt huge but it is decent sized. I put it in the living room, all the on one end and tested in my room which is located on the other side of the house. I usually have full bars in my room. I tested it with Verizon fios Gigabit connection while sitting next to the router and got 500 MB download and upload (gigabit connection is 960 MB max). Just to give you a rough idea, it's about 50 away, with 4 walls in between them. I purchased this router because I didn't want to pay $199 for their one time purchase on the router or pay them $12 a month to rent it... get real. Within a few months this router pays for itself. I hope this review helps my fellow shoppers.
title: Highly recommend for the price and quality.

author: EMMANUEL BELLON
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
review_content: When the parental control of my Spectrum services and router failed to work, I purchased A7 and started managing it with TP-Link. It helped me to control the the number of hours my children spend on the internet during this time of lockdown and learning at home. Also, I needed to block certain websites that cause distraction to their school work. My parental control has worked perfectly.
title: Parental Control

author: Barry Lentz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019
review_content: Bought this to replace an Airport Extreme that stopped working properly.  It would not access my usb back-up disks.  Wasted hours trying to get it to work.  TP-Link phone support was OK but not useful.  Finally got an email from TP-Link on-line Support that the router can only support NTFS and FAT32 formats.  My discs were formatted in Mac OS10-Extended, which is required for Time Machine.  It is a descent router that supports mesh, but was no faster than my Airport Extreme, but with many headaches to get it to work with MacBook Pro.  Shame on Apple for discontinuing the Airport Extreme without updating Time Machine to use other formats.  Maybe I need a different computer!
title: Not a good choice to replace an Airport Extreme

author: Steven Halper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
review_content: I bought the TPC Archer A7 router to replace an 8 year netgear router. I have two access points connected to the base router. The old Netgear router needed to be reset continually. I bought the TPC based on combination of price and product reviews. I'm one day in and it appears to be working great. I have another Netgear router as an access point and that seems to working much better now as well. Based on first day performance, so far so good.
title: So far So Good

author: Chas Tomasik
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
review_content: This router is well worth the money. The signal is strong and covers my whole house (1600 sq. Ft) and even reaches to my back patio with no problems at all. Best of all you can control who is on it and block any device connected to it. Easy tool for punishments without even having to raise your voice
title: Best parenting tool evvvvaaaa

author: R. Bowman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: Only purchased product after being told it would work with Nord VPN.  Tech support says it's product will not work with any encrypted VPN
title: Does not work with Nord VPN

author: Shane R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2019
review_content: I have had this router up and running for almost a month.  It works really well and is a good value for the price.  The tether app works great and made it easy to install the unit.  I bridged it off of my Comcast modem/wireless router.  I did not like the existing wireless range with the Comcast unit.  The range on this unit is very nice.  It is also kicking out 5-7 times higher speeds than the Comcast unit.  Comcast wireless was only giving me 25-30 Mbps.  With the TP-Link I am getting upwards of 160-180 Mbps wireless now.  And the range is a lot better as well.  I did, however, have to reset it once because the wireless speed was falling to essentially nil.  But it has worked fine since then.
title: I like this router

author: shewhue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: This product sucks!! It locks me out of my printer which was working fine before. I had to register all my devices in some highly convoluted process, which requires you to put this stupid app on your phone, and to cap it off, the customer service is the pits. You call for assistance and all they did was to refer you to a website which was just as useless.Many weak links not good.!
title: Stay away from this crappy device!!

author: Moospuh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
review_content: Theres no Way to block domains on this router. just parental controls to look for 'Keywords" on websites to block' and not specific domain Url names.
title: Cant Block Domains

author: Greg01X
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: I replaced an aging Apple Airport Extreme with this router after a bad experience with another brand. Setup was quick and easy and there was no longer a need for a range booster. Both the 5 and 2.4GHz wifi signals are strong. I'm also using all 4 wired ports along with the USB port for an external disk. The only downside I've noticed so far is that the WPS light came on without my having pressed the button on the back of the router. Pressing the button fixed the problem but one wonders is this is a potential security vulnerability. On the other hand, it could have been a one-off. Hopefully it will keep working well.
title: So Far, So Good

author: NKA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
review_content: This works fine, but has a hard time prioritizing multiple units. I made a mistake in purchasing this thinking this was Mimo-mu, and am now looking for one that can actually handle multi units - Which is only a few bucks more. It still works, but not well for a family if each member has phone and a laptop.  Ignore this one, spend a bit more and you won't regret it.
title: Moderately Good- But do yourself a favor and spend a bit more for the Mimo- Mu editions

author: Candor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: At first the router was fine. But 3 months after purchase, its ethernet jacks started getting spotty. At random times the internet would just cut out for about 5 minutes, and then resume. Directly connected my computer to my modem and all was fine. So, problem with the router. Weathered the problem for about another 3 months before it started becoming a really annoying.Step 1: Contact Amazon!Long story short, Amazon told me I'm **** out of luck, but they'll give me the phone number for TP-Link customer service.Step 2: Call TP-LinkAgent #1: Tried to tell me that my internet wasn't working because my ethernet cable wasn't plugged into the router. Took a bit for him to understand that I'm plugged into the modem because the router is broken. Walked me through updating the firmware of the router, which I admittedly forgot during my own trouble shooting.Agent #2: Called back a fer hours later when it was clear that the firmware update didn't fix the problem. Agent#2 was actually helpful in promising me a replacement router, but I had to first register my current hardware. He sent me and email with the steps and wished me luck.Step 3: Registering the RouterAgent #3: I had to get in touch with Agent#3 because the aforementioned email took me to a registration system that didn't want to accept my router's serial number. Checked it a bunch of times, and despite being correct, the system disagreed. Agent#3 told me this was happening because I didn't legitimately purchase the device. After hitting him with various images of proof of purchase from Amazon, the S/N number under the machine itself, and a shot of the registration system rejecting the number, he tersely told me to try again. Worked like magic. But first I had to deal with his insulting behavior and comments.After all that, is the problem solved? Don't know. Maybe. It's in limbo now. Let's see if they actually send a replacement as promised. But why did it go bad in less than 6 months from purchase? Why was Amazon unhelpful? Why were 2 out of 3 of TP-Link's agents condescending? WHY did I have to contact an agent to make the system accept the serial number on the BOTTOM OF THE MACHINE? Good questions.Buyer ****ing beware.UPDATE: Received a second email shortly after. Apparently TP-Link requires me to pay for the very expensive shipping and handling for my replacement. Now, I know for a fact that shipping something of this router's weight costs appr. $8. USD. They want much more. So, they're trying to profit off their faulty product. I think I'll just pay full price for another router made by another company, and wash my hands of TP-Link.
title: What a Nightmare

author: Ray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: Easy to use and setup. Just moved to a new house and TP-Link was one of the brands that my internet provider recommended. Setup was easy and I have had no issues for the two months I have been using. I have two computers. two tablets and two TVs in the house and it handles all my needs. The house is a single story three bedroom house with the router on the bottom shelf of a bookcase. (The location of the router could be better but it was the most convenient location.)  Signal is strong everywhere in the house including the front and back porches. I recommend this product
title: Good product at a good price. Easy to install.

author: SailorHarry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: This item arrived before the due date.  Securely packaged, it was blemish-free.  The installation instructions were easy to follow.  This router with an Addis 3.1 router boosted our download speed from 35 mb/sec to 200 mb/sec—no kidding!  We have been paying Xfinity for 200 mb/sec service for years.  The Xfinity service technician advised us to upgrade from 3.0 to 3.1 and WOW!  We are screaming along!  An ethernet cable RJ-45 was included with the router and another one with the modem, so do not order a separate cable—we did and cancelled the cable as it was over a week out from delivery.  Thanks, Amazon.
title: Get the internet speed that you are paying for!

author: Ak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
review_content: Really enjoy the ease of setting this up. Used this to convert my spectrum router/modem combo into just a modem, and then used this as the router. Really improved my experience with the wifi in my apartment. I think it got fasted and more reliable due to this switch and I couldn't be more happier.Some complaints: The app is iffy. It keeps wanting me to set the router up but it's already been set. It worked really well for the initial set up though.
title: Easy set up, great speeds

author: D Camp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020
review_content: We decided to finally replace our 8-10 yr old router and this was a HUGE mistake. This router may seem like a bargain, but it’s actually just junk. When it actually works, it is fast; however, it rarely seems to work. We spend a substantial amount of time trying to reconnect our devices, which randomly get booted off. Also, the user interface is terrible. The site was constantly freezing, and it crashed AT LEAST 5 times when we were trying to change guest network and password settings. I finally gave up. I’m returning this disaster router. I strongly recommend considering literally any other router. Currently writing this review using cellular data because, yet again, I’ve been randomly kicked off the network.
title: Do not buy this.

author: Louis J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
review_content: The description and other reviews tell the story.  What they didn't say was that there are keyhole slots in the bottom to allow it to be mounted on a wall or ceiling.  This is an important feature in certain situations, and should be part of the product description.  Do you loose internet and have to reboot your router?  Another item that is not mentioned is automatic reboot, every day, week, or month if you need it.  My previous router needed that, but my TP-Link hasn't needed it.  Oh, one other thing.  Most routers can be set up as an access point, which can be tricky.  This one has the option built in to the firmware - simple!
title: Works well.  Has all the features you would need, then some.

author: Denys
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
review_content: The Archer 7 is working very well.  After I figured out how to install it behind my AT&T router, it was a breeze to setup as the router for my mesh network.  I added a couple of RE300 range extenders for superb Wi-Fi throughout the house.  I also added some storage to the USB port and now that's accessible from anywhere.The Tether app works really well with the TP-Link products.
title: Easy to install and use.  Works really well.

author: Djembedrummer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
review_content: ...it dropped the internet once.  It went another week, dropped again.  Then, it started happening every few days, then daily, then a couple of times a day.  I tried chat w/ tech support and for two hours got "canned" questions over and over again, often repeating the same questions.  After a while, you get it: tech support isn't trying to solve the problem.  Compare that to Sony tech support that spent twenty minutes with me troubleshooting my new TV.  Problem solved.Two good things that did happen is that on the very day the router entirely quit working, my new router arrived.  And, second, I was one day within the time-limit window to return it to Amazon.
title: It was fine for two weeks, but then...

author: Sharath T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: For the cost it is priced at and the features it has, it is really one of the best routers available. This supports mesh network and has 2.5GHz and 5GHz variations and guest wifi. An awesomely easy way to setup. I didn't even connect this to a laptop/computer to set it up. Finished the setup by connecting through bluetooth through my smart phone app. Has a USB port and this made my life easy, as I connect my external HDD to this router and stream to my smart TV. Its been couple of months that I started using this and great so far.
title: Great router for affordable price

author: Enthusiast
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: I have suddenlink and used the original Hitron router/modem that they gave me. I started wanting a modem so I could quit paying rent on one and decided to go with a modem and external router. I found the TP-Link AC1750, read the reviews and took a shot along with an Arris SB6183. While I was waiting on a call back to activate the modem, I went ahead and plugged in the router to the original Hitron to test it out... I be danged if my download speed jumped up to 200 mbps vs 46! Once I got the setup done and running, I turned on every device I had on hand (7 devices) and streamed video and reran the test to find ZERO bog down of speed. Great buy for me and the family.
title: Fantastic speed at a very economical price

author: C. Montoya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2019
review_content: I needed to upgrade a cheap router that started putting out poor signal.  I first turned to the Netgear ac750 which worked, but the app and set up were terrible.  While the netgear performed fine I was getting 67 to 72 mbps download.I got the TP Link ac1750 on sale for about the same price and was amazed by the tether app and how easy the set up and management was.  I got a small improvement to download speed at 87 to 93 mbps.Firmware updated 1.0.7 build 20181210 which is recent.  I gave 4 stars only because it takes up some extra real estate and feels kind of cheap.  Overall I am very happy with this router and the app is fantastic, I highly recommed the TP Link ac1750.
title: Big performance, small price

author: SLI.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: We have been running into an issue where both ethernet and wireless connection drop and cannot be reconnected to. I have contacted tplink chat support 5x for this issue and they keep pushing me off as I am pretty sure they have a policy against replacing the device which is incredibly frustrating because I wish I had just thrown it into the garbage after the first sign of an issue because I have spent such a ridiculous amount of time troubleshooting this.
title: Works great when it works.

author: Jingwei Ma
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
review_content: iI had the worst ever customer experience with TP-LINK USA today. I have been having wifi issues for several mth. I just assumed its the internet provider with overwhelming WFH demands. My cable provider finally came, managed to identify the issue is related to my wifi router. we also did testing to validate the internet is stable from the cable box output. I personally observed the TPLINK WIFI router shutdown and restarted many times on its own within the hour. while I described the phenomenon to the TP LINK customer service on the phone, she refused to take any action because the wifi is not having issues at that particular moment, so their device is good. She asked me to send her an email when the issue present so she can catch the error message, however I did not receive any email from TPLINK, she disconnected the phone call without advise any claim number or her name for me trace down. When I requested to speak with a supervisor, I was simply told. no supervisor is available..... so guys, good luck if you have any issue with the device, its considered trashed if its outside the Amazon return period. I tried to file a claim online, the device SN cannot be registered which a claim cannot be filed online or attain a replacement request. There is practically no customer service provided....
title: worst customer experience

author: Brannon Hancock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: This replaced an older Netgear router that I didn't realize was slowing me down as much as it apparently was. This new TPLink is faster and gives us better coverage on the upper floors of the house, including my son's room in the finished attic (2 floors up from the router). Really pleased with it's performance. I have used the web admin interface a good bit, too, to set up a white list, and set it up as well to reboot in the middle of the night once weekly. Solid product for the average web-using household (ours: video games, streaming TV, web use... as many as 7-8 devices at once), I should think!
title: big upgrade to speeds and coverage

author: Scott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
review_content: I was having internet drops daily.....when I called my internet provider (small company since I live out in the country ) they said I had 17 devices connected to my modem...the modem they provided only was able to handle 8-10....I bought this bad boy and I haven’t had drops and my speed has been higher ....super easy to set up and works great
title: Great product

author: Swiss Family Treehouse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
review_content: Pros: We are able to control the usage of up to 4 users when on the WiFi or when connected through the Ethernet cable by setting time limits for all weekdays and weekends.  There can be websites that are blocked on internet sites, which is a plus.Cons: It can be difficult to access the main tether app when necessary, which will prevent any changes to the main tether link box.  This kept me from accessing my computer’s internet for school purposes one day. Even though I was connected via Ethernet  I couldn’t change the time limit via the tether app, which could have been a disaster on a different day for work.I didn’t try the tether technical help to know how well they assist.Overall we will keep the unit and hope that the tether app has less glitches/errors when trying to login to access any control options.
title: Strong WiFi, usually accessible tether app

author: PQW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
review_content: Had an old TP router (>3 yrs) and it seemed to be failing because I constantly had to power it on and off.  Bought this one since my old TP had been so reliable.  Set up did not work.  Had to enter the password for each of the dual band frequencies which I was not prepared to do, the old one did this seamlessly.  Got it to work on my iphone eventually, but not the ipad or Roku and it was incredibly slow on my phone.  I bailed when the troubleshooter started to ask about the MAC address and to contact my ISP - Spectrum - no thanks.  Returned it before I got too deep in those weeds.  Just wanted a plug and play solution.  Still looking - maybe netgear
title: Not as straightforward as the instructions said

author: Brian Hurst
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2019
review_content: I initially liked this router. It worked as advertised, and was able to pull ISP speeds (400 Mbps) through both wifi and hard wired connections.Fast forward 3 weeks, and I am no longer able to get the same speed through the device. I have checked all the cables, and when I hard wire directly to my ISP modem, I get the same 400 Mbps service. As soon as I connect back through the TP-link AC1750, it drops to 50Mbps. I tried calling tech support, but their official answer was wait for the update as the connection speed between my computer and the router was stated at 1Gbps.But on the bright side, the wifi signal is strong throughout the house, and even the yard.
title: SLOWWW

author: KT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020
review_content: About a month ago I was starting to have issues on my google hangout meetings. My video and audio was choppy, that it got to the point where I was having to conduct meetings on my phone.I tried a variety of things to try to resolve the issue, but to no avail. At first I thought maybe it was a modem issue. But then my co-worker suggested that I was having latency issues. I googled how to improve latency and unfortunately, there really aren't a whole lot of things you can do to improve latency... except get a new router. I'd had my router for about 4 years, so I figured it may be time for a new one anyway.After setting up this router, my issues on google hangout have gone away. Video and audio quality is clear receiving and transmitting. I'm hoping this router will last as long as my last!
title: So far so good...

author: Rajiv Jain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: This is my 5th TP-Link router. My previous routers lasted 3+ years. However, this router is showing symptoms of a bad Router just 4 months after the purchase. At random intervals through out the day the Internet traffic slows down, downloads become sluggish, devices get randomly disconnected or show poor signal strength. I expect to upgrade Wi-Fi router every 24-36 months, but just 4 months of useful life is not acceptable. Also, forget about calling and getting support when you need it.
title: Avoid buying this router. Flakey Wi-Fi signal
